sec.p: Daily rainfall was important in explaining daily variation in parental visitation rates to nestlings, as increasing the amount of daily rainfall reduced average hourly visitation rates ( Tables S1 and 3; Fig. 3). This negative effect was further enhanced by the amount of rainfall over 2 or 3Â days preceding the day of visitation ( Tables S1 and 3).

div.p: The relationship between the number of visits per hour and daily amount of rainfall during day of visitation. Lines are model predictions and their 95% CIs from the top-ranked model ( Table S1) when all explanatory variables other than daily rainfall (i.e., hour, hour 2, chick age, chick age 2, and prior rain) were fixed at their mean values.
